**Nice-to-Have Skills:** 



* Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD).
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD).
* Familiarity with databases and frontend frameworks (React, Angular, Vue).



**What’s on Offer?** 



* **Hybrid Work Setup** 
 : Flexible arrangement with a modern central office in Stockholm; typically, 3 days in the office weekly.
* **Benefits Package** 
 :
* Wellness allowance.
* Collective agreements.
* Six weeks of vacation.
* Comprehensive office equipment.



  





**About the Employer** 




 Our client is a financially stable and globally recognized IT services company with a focus on delivering high-impact projects that improve lives. With a strong developer community and a reputation as one of Sweden's best workplaces, this is an opportunity to grow your career while contributing to meaningful projects.
 



 If you’re ready to take the next step in your Java development career, apply today and join a team that values community, innovation, and societal impact!

title: Lead Principal Software Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Principle/Lead Software engineer position - Stockholm/remote
 



  





 I'm working with one of Sweden's most innovative startups, a renowned company who are pioneering the online retail space, with cutting-edge technology and AI, and empowering e-commerce brands to optimize their platform and operations to be able to compete with global retailers worldwide!
 



  





 With a hyper-intelligent merchandising application and Shopify platform, are a 'co-pilot' for online brands worldwide, enabling them to create incredibly user-centric platforms and enhance their operations through the use of AI, LLMs, NLPs, which ultimately has a direct impact on the user experience of millions of shoppers globally!
 



  





 With solid finances and a very strong culture of humility and collaboration, whilst also having the best of the best when it comes to their tech team, they are in a fantastic position to grow. With decisions to be made on how to evolve their existing platform, as-well as huge scope for new feature development, they are looking for a principle/lead software engineer to help them drive forward!
 



  





 Working directly with a super-talented 6 person tech lead, you will be hands on with the code, but also working directly with the CEO & VP of product, bringing your ideas to the table on how to innovate & evolve the product, with the user always in mind in what is a product-led growth journey, with a roadmap and vision for this person to step into the formal CTO role if you wish.
 



  





 This is a permanent role, with their office in Stockholm, but with huge flexibility to work remotely too.
 



  





**What you will do** 
 :
 



  




* Drive the pace, velocity, and ambition of the engineering team (not a man management role, but being an integral part of a fantastic tech team whilst driving things forward!)
* Be able to say ‘we should do this’, not just ‘we could do this’ - a forward thinker!
* Align technical, merchant, product and business needs
* Set and implement the technical vision, direction and standards for the company - closely with the CEO & VP of product
* Identify opportunities for innovation and improvement across tech/process/people
* Lead, motivate, and coach performance/feedback to build a lovable product that sells
* Make daily decisions & tradeoffs between speed/quality to find the best solutions
* Determine different solutions for different situations: e.g. features, platform



  





  





**Requirements/Nice to haves:** 




  




* 5-10 years of Experience with consumer-facing, product led growth and distribution - ideally working on building and growing products to production with large user volume.



  




* Need to be product minded, how to develop a product, how to evolve a product in line with the business goals and customer needs, and a strong understanding of UX



  




* Experience with our stack: a React Typescript Frontend and a modern, well-typed Python (fastapi, pydantic) backend. Our Infrastructure runs on Kubernetes in GCP with ArgoCD.



  




* Experience in B2C / B2B SaaS



  




* Ideally experience in an Editor-type product: customizable/creative for the many - experience in e-commerce, Shopify etc also beneficial.



  




* Able to create a forward vision about what AI can do to from both a development and feature point of view



  





**Benefits:** 




  




* Highly competitive salary
* Pension
* 4000 SEK in annual wellness allowance
* 10,000 SEK annual learning allowance
* 30 paid vacation days
* Monthly co-working space allowance (if outside of Stockholm)
* Company Laptop
* Quarterly off-site socials
* Huge scope for growth

title: .NET Software Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**The team:** 
 Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for an application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together, while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact:** 
 OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. We keep our eyes on the horizon, always on the lookout for new possibilities and opportunities while staying with our feet on the ground, making sure we deliver rock solid services that our clients rely on for their daily business and success. Our optimization services create distinct positive impacts to client portfolio risk profiles and operational costs. When our services execute, global metrics of systemic risks in
   

  

 the financial markets improve significantly. Long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s in it for you:** 
 We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities
* Innovative culture with strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements
* NET Software Engineer Position Profile


 We are seeking a passionate and talented individual to join our innovative and
   

  

 forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimized and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a .NET Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects using your focus, talent, passion, and grit. You will be responsible for driving modernisation and implementing .NET best practices together with the rest of the team to ensure that the system is fit for purpose, up-to-date and easy to adapt to new business requirements. We are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science or have equivalent education or background, and have 0-5 years of relevant work experience. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks
* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices


**Qualifications**
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent background
* 0-5 years experience with .NET-based technologies
* Solid experience in C# development
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative


 environment
   

  

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team


 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 306801
   

  

**Posted On:** 
 2024-11-25
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Fullstack Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment?
 



  





 Are you based in Sweden with ability to work on-site with our clients in the Stockholm area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Fullstack Developer** 




 As a Fullstack Developer, you will play a pivotal role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a hands-on developer. Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



  





 Your role as a consultant/client advisor will not only entail providing technical knowledge but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



  





 Assignments and clients vary, but our main aim is to always make great high-quality customer experiences that last. We achieve this by using technical solutions that add value, not just for our clients, but also for their customers.
 



  





 In addition, you will:
 


* Act as a trusted advisor to our clients, offering guidance and solutions to address their business needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy fullstack solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a skilled full-stack developer with around 5 years of experience working across both front-end and back-end technologies. You're comfortable navigating diverse tech stacks, and you take pride in writing clean, maintainable code.
 



  





 You enjoy collaborating with various stakeholders, both internal and external, and fellow developers, translating business requirements into technical solutions that add value. With a passion for learning and staying current with industry trends, you’re eager to contribute to dynamic projects while continuously growing your skill set.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* Around 5 years of experience in fullstack development, with hands-on experience in modern frameworks and technologies
* A proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* A willingness to move freely within the entire technology stack and experience working in agile working environment
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Fluency in Swedish and English



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* .NET Core /C#, Node.js
* React, TypeScript, Vue
* Headless CMS architectures and technologies
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence



  





**Bonus if you also have:** 



* Experience or strong interest in Angular and Ruby on Rails
* CMS/eCommerce platforms like Sitecore, Adobe, Optimizely, etc.
* A cloud provider like Azure or AWS



  





 Read more about life at Valtech and what we offer by clicking on "Apply".

title: Software Developer, Nordea Node
description:
**Job ID: 27610** 




 Are you a person motivated by delivering business value through software automation? Nordea Node is now looking to recruit a new Backend Software Developer as part of Nordea Life & Pensions Sweden’s continued push in digitalizing the insurance market. Nordea Node currently works with some of Sweden’s leading employers, including tech, IT-consultants and law firms.
 



 This role is based in Malmo, Stockholm, Sweden. This is a permanent, full-time, Hybrid, position.
 



 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank, we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
 



**About our team** 




 Nordea Nodes mission is to help employers and their employees towards a better and safer life. We offer you an exciting workplace with the opportunity to work on a modern technology stack (microservices, GraphQL, Node.js, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform) developing the premier benefit brokerage platform in Sweden. Our tech and product team consist of around 20 highly motivated colleagues. At Nordea Node you get to work in a dynamic start-up-like environment, whilst having access to the great benefit package offered by Nordea Group and Nordea Life & Pensions Sweden.
 



 As the Backend Developer at Nordea Node you will be part of an agile team responsible for writing and maintaining several services in our microservice architecture.
 



**The responsibilities include:** 



* Develop new features in close collaboration with other teams, product managers, business users and other stakeholders
* Instrument applications for observability, debugging and continuous improvement
* Work with our infrastructure team to implement best practices in terms of security and availability
* Continuously monitor the performance of the team’s services to fulfill SLOs and resolve issues



**Who you are** 




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 



 As the Backend Developer at Nordea Node you have a great interest in the business, facilitating a great understanding of the business logic necessary to deliver concrete business value for our users.
 



**We are looking for a person with:** 



* Formal education in computer science and/or software development
* Experience with Kubernetes and microservice architectures
* Experience with DevOps and continuous delivery



**Nice to have:** 



* Experience writing Node.js microservices
* Experience writing GraphQL apis
* Experience from the insurance industry



**What we offer** 




 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 



**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 



**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
 



**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 




 Submit your application no later than 07/02/2025. For more information, you are welcome to contact Theodor Lindquist (theodor.lindquist@nordeanode.se) for this opportunity related queries and Ritu Mittal ( ritu.mittal@consult.nordea.com ) for HR related matters.
 



**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 




**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 



**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
 



**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 



**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
 



 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
 



 ​For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: AI Software Developer
description:
Din roll
   

  

 Som AI Software Developer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av avancerade AI-applikationer. I rollen arbetar du med de senaste teknologierna inom AI och maskininlärning och tar fram lösningar som är skalbara och anpassade för våra kunders behov. Du bidrar med teknisk vägledning och fattar strategiska beslut kring arkitektur och lösningsdesign. Samtidigt stödjer och inspirerar du teamet till teknisk excellens.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en miljö där innovation och samarbete är i fokus, och du får möjlighet att vara del av ett passionerat team som arbetar med projekt i framkant av AI-teknologin. Genom rollen kommer du att få erfarenhet av olika verksamheter och tekniska miljöer, vilket gör att du utvecklas och breddar din kompetens.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att:
   

  

* Arbeta som Tech Lead eller i en liknande ledande roll inom AI-utveckling.
* Ge teknisk vägledning och fatta strategiska beslut kring arkitektur och lösningsdesign.
* Stödja teammedlemmar och inspirera till teknisk excellens.
* Bygga AI-lösningar som är skalbara, hållbara och anpassade för kundernas behov.


 Du har arbetat inom några av följande områden:
   

  

* Programmering: Python (gärna med bibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch eller Scikit-learn).
* AI-teknik: Erfarenhet av LLM (Large Language Models), Transformer-arkitekturer och generativa AI-verktyg.
* MLOps: Erfarenhet av verktyg för AI-pipelines som Kubeflow, MLflow eller liknande.
* Containerteknik: Docker och Kubernetes.
* API-utveckling: REST och/eller GraphQL.
* Molnplattformar: AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.


 Meriterande erfarenheter
   

  

 Det är extra meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap om databaser som SQL eller NoSQL.
* Byggt och optimerat kontinuerliga integrations- och leveransprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av datavisualiseringsverktyg som Tableau eller Power BI.
* Stark förståelse för matematik, statistik och optimering.
* Intresse för etiska och ansvarfulla AI-principer, inklusive fairness och explainability.


 Varför Knowit?
   

  

 På Knowit Connectivity får du en unik möjlighet att kombinera teknik och innovation med personlig utveckling. Vi är ett team av engagerade och kunniga medarbetare som brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder och samhället. Hos oss får du arbeta i en miljö där din kompetens tas till vara och där du får chansen att växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss? Besök vår hemsida eller kontakta oss direkt!
   

  

 Låter detta som en roll för dig?
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Valtech söker en erfaren Fullstack-utvecklare till vårt dynamiska team i Stockholm. Har du erfarenhet av .NET och React och vill vara med och skapa innovativa, skalbara lösningar? Då är detta rollen för dig! Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt kreativa och växande team.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som Fullstack-utvecklare hos Valtech får du en central roll där du både fungerar som teknisk rådgivare och praktisk utvecklare. Du kommer att vara involverad i hela projektets livscykel – från discovery till leverans. I rollen arbetar du nära både interna team och våra kunder för att skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Agera som pålitlig rådgivare för våra kunder och bidra till att hitta tekniska lösningar som matchar deras affärsbehov.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att designa och implementera fullstacklösningar.
* Delta i workshops, kundmöten och presentationer för att säkerställa att projekten genomförs effektivt och transparent.
* Ständigt bidra till förbättring av våra utvecklingsmetoder och processer.


**Om Dig**
 Vi söker en Fullstack-utvecklare med cirka 5 års erfarenhet och ett genuint intresse för att utveckla både front-end och back-end lösningar. Du är en lagspelare som trivs i samarbete och har förmågan att översätta affärsbehov till hållbara tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Dina Kvalifikationer**
* Cirka 5 års erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling.
* God erfarenhet av teknologier som .NET Core, C#, React, TypeScript, Vue, Node.js och GraphQL.
* Förmåga att arbeta med API-integrationer och CMS-teknologier (t.ex. headless CMS).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila miljöer med verktyg som Jira och Confluence.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Du har också möjlighet att arbeta på plats i Stockholmsområdet.


**Bonus Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* Angular, Ruby on Rails, eller CMS/e-handelsplattformar som Sitecore, Optimizely och Adobe.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som Azure eller AWS.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
 På Valtech får du arbeta med några av de mest innovativa projekten och kunderna. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och stimulerande arbetsmiljö där kreativitet och teknisk utveckling går hand i hand. Här får du möjlighet att växa tillsammans med företaget och ta ansvar för spännande utmaningar.
   

  

**Valtechs Kultur**
 Vår kultur präglas av våra värderingar: Share, Care, Dare. Vi tror på samarbete, omtanke och mod att ta initiativ. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta tillsammans med passionerade kollegor som strävar efter att skapa de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att ha roligt och att utvecklas tillsammans.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Avigna is hiring Data Engineer** 








 Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for
 **Data Engineer** 
 to join Join a large-scale data transformation journey as a Data Engineer, contributing to the development and optimization of data products based on the Data Mesh concept. You will work with a global team to build data solutions that are scalable, secure, and high-performing, ensuring data quality and accessibility for various business needs.
 



 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
 







**Experience** 
 : 5+
 



**Location** 
 : Stockholm
 



**Mode of work** 
 : Hybrid (40% remote allowed)
 







**Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Take ownership of building, optimizing, and supporting data products based on the defined vision and requirements.
* Apply DevOps principles to manage CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure, and terraform in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Ensure data products meet standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to refine existing data products and identify new ones that align with customer needs.
* Work with product teams across domains to implement the Data Mesh concept.
* Continuously improve solutions and reduce technical debt within teams.
* Stay updated with the latest advancements in data, analytics, and cloud technologies.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* A strong passion for working with data, people, and technology.
* At least 4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, preferably on GCP or similar cloud platforms.
* Expertise in GCP tools like DBT and BigQuery.
* Proficiency in working with data formats such as Parquet and Avro.
* Experience with SQL or other data query languages.
* Knowledge of data-centric programming using Python, Java, or Scala.
* Familiarity with various data modeling techniques and their trade-offs.
* Understanding of NoSQL and relational databases.



**Additional Skills:** 



* A collaborative mindset and excellent communication skills.
* The ability to work independently and make decisions.
* Experience with data visualization tools is a plus.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Knowledge of the retail industry is an advantage.







 What we offer:
 






* Access to a strong developer community within the company to learn and grow.
* Competitive Salary, Good work-life balance along with health and life insurance.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Are you ready to take the next step in your career? At PwC, we believe in leveraging our different perspectives to jointly develop tomorrow's businesses and organizations. We share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Are you ready to explore new career opportunities with us?**
**Become part of PwC's business support team**
 As an employee within PwC's business support, you have an important role in ensuring that the organization functions smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our customers and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that work together to support the internal operations. We work with everything from communication, marketing, employees and , IT to finance, purchasing, risk management and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating across these different departments, the organization can benefit from our specialized knowledge to support and improve the business at large.
   

  

**Are you our new colleague in the business support team?**
 To thrive in this role, we envision that you excel in collaboration and enjoy building relationships with both colleagues and clients. You are naturally curious, adaptable, and find joy in solving problems, preferably within a team. Moreover, you are motivated by taking personal responsibility and achieving results. The opportunities for development are substantial, facilitated by our comprehensive training programs and collaboration within the teams you're part of. Strong communication skills are essential, and you thrive in working in diverse environments, as a significant portion of the daily work takes place at client locations
   

  

**Your Main Tasks As a Experienced Fullstack Developer**
* Using feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.
* Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities and coach to help deliver results.
* Develop new ideas and propose innovative solutions to the problems.
* Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.
* Share knowledge within the team and PWC.
* Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing others.
* Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality, diverse relationships.
* Support and mentor team members when needed.
* Be an essential part of the team, in addition to its culture and ways of working. Day-to-day practices include agile methodologies, pair and mob programming.


**Qualifications For The Position**
* C#/.NET
* Angular
* REST and Entity framework
* Javascript/Typescript
* SQL and cloud platforms (Azure)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Azure Devops Services or similar


 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV


 We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Full Stack Developer  .Net React Next.js
description:
**Please not that working proficiency in Swedish language is required.** 




  




* Är du en erfaren utvecklare inom C# .Net, React, Next.js, Typescript samt älskar att resa på fritiden?
* Vill du bidra till att skapa den bästa kundresan & reseupplevelsen för våra kunder?
* Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare?



  





*Då är rollen som Erfaren Systemutvecklare på Apollo som klippt och skuren för dig som söker en kompetent miljö, läs gärna vidare!* 




  





**Bakgrund** 




 För Apollo är utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss. Just nu arbetar vi med att byta ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful, samtidigt bygger vi en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare ges än större befogenheter och ansvar
 *för vår plattform.* 
 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen genom att driva innovation som hjälper våra kunder att hitta, konfigurera och beställa sin drömresa. Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med våra produktägare och UX designers driver gemensamt utvecklingen av sitt område framåt, både på produktnivå såväl som tekniskt. Vi arbetar nära övriga avdelningar för att säkerställa att vi på bästa sätt nyttjar den långa och breda erfarenhet vi som organisation har om de resor vi erbjuder.
 



 Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT,
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare med ca fem till sju års yrkesrelaterad erfarenhet, gärna med konsultbakgrund och kring tekniker som av Fullstack C# .Net, React, Next.js, Typescript etc.
 



 Du uttrycker dig väl på både engelska och svenska i tal och skrift och det är extra meriterande om du har erfarenhet kring Contentful, gärna CMS och PIM, personification och gamification, CI, Cloud Services som AWS eller Azure samt Terraform.
 



  





**Personlighet** 




 Då utvecklingsteamet arbetar riktigt verksamhetsnära är förmågan till goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och Apollo är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du. Vidare är du en nyfiken social och kreativ lagspelare, kompetent, kommunikativ och stolt över ditt yrkeskunnande. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback samt mån om att arbeta med kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som verksamheten.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Apollo erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv. Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och har utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas, tillsammans i teamen! Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner.
 



  





**Kontakt & Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby – The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Omar Burazerovic på 0728–897441
 



  





**Om Apollo** 




 Apollo är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel. Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland. Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

title: Automotive/Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Want to take your coding skills to the next level in embedded systems development within Automotive? Look no further! Knowit Connectivity is an enthusiastic and rapidly expanding IT consultancy firm that thrives on innovation and technology. As we continue to grow, we're on the hunt for skilled and ambitious individuals to join our team and help us achieve even greater success.
   

  

**Your role as an Automotive Engineer**
 We are looking for you who enjoys being part of a team and take responsibility for your contribution to the team. Flexibility and curiosity are words that fit you together with an innovative and open mind to other ideas and input. Our ideal candidates is more than an experts - they're an exceptional communicators, a proactive problem-solvers, and a dedicated learner who passionately imparts knowledge to their peers. We do also value your curiosity and interest in the technical prospect, as our world and the industry environments constantly are changing. Our customers are within the Stockholm region and today we have a hybrid way of working with a mix of onsite, in-house and remote work depending on the projects.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we expect you to have experience in:**
* Either C++/C programming or model based development using Simulink
* End-to-end development (Design, implementation, documentation, testing, verification, validation…)
* Linux
* Knowledge of ISO26262, ISO 21434, and/or A-SPICE


**It is meriting if you also have experience in one or more of the following:**
* Working with automotive communication (e.g. CAN, Automotive Ethernet, etc.)
* Working with real-time systems
* Scripting in Python
* Testing on unit, integration and/or system level
* Testing using HIL, PIL and/or SIL.


**Other things that would be interesting if you had experience in are**
* Requirements management
* Working with Autosar; classic or adaptive
* Experience in working with verification and validation
* Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc)


 This job requires that you can express yourself well in English, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

**About Us**
 Knowit offers an exciting workplace that provides great opportunities for our employees to develop, both professionally and personally. With supportive, versatile, and creative colleagues, we at Knowit Connectivity Stockholm offer an exciting and inclusive culture where we strive to ensure a healthy balance between private life and professional life. In addition to complementing each other professionally, we also make sure we have fun together, both inside and outside of office hours, with a variety of events such as workshops, informative seminars and casual after-works.
   

  

 All our leaders have a great focus on our employees and through a close dialogue with you, we promise to do our utmost to make the next project the best of your life so far. We are a company that values a culture of closeness and community. We listen when you have suggestions for improvements or new ideas for events and will always encourage you to try new solutions. Knowit is a fast-paced, fun, and inspiring workplace with a great team spirit. With us, you work to make a difference and to develop both Knowit’ s business and our customers.
   

  

**Application**
 Apply now trough the link or contact responsible recruiter Rasmus Lundin rasmus.lundin@knowit.se or hiring manager Joakim Oscarsson, joakim.oscarsson@knowit.se for more information or questions.

title: System Developer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We are looking for a motivated, enthusiastic system engineers who want to work in a company the develops system that keeps people and things connected. You will participate in the development of our future telecom systems.
   

  

 Are you interested in continuously being challenged with exciting new technology and sophisticated system solutions? We are curious and eager to add your knowledge, skills, creativity, and previous experiences to our team.
   

  

 We are growing in Resource Handling area that orchestrate, allocate, configure and supervise needed resources for sector carrier between L3 and antenna in the Radio Node. Our focus is with 5G in the areas of NG-OLLS, IoT, Cloud, Advanced Antenna Systems, beamforming, and 6G is starting up.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Serve as a central figure in analyzing and describing solutions for our telecom systems.
* Collaborate closely with design and verification teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality.
* Engage with other system engineers, designers, and internal stakeholders to create cohesive and innovative technical solutions.
* Analyze and deconstruct requirements to develop simple yet effective solutions for complex problems.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of system architecture that supports our cutting-edge technologies.


**The skills you bring:**
* Ambition to become a technical leader and build deep technical knowledge.
* Ability to quickly learn new concepts and actively seek opportunities for growth and development.
* A social, committed, and creative personality with a passion for technical challenges.
* Strong teamwork skills, with a focus on delivering high-quality results on time.
* Open and honest communication style, fostering a collaborative work environment.
* Several years of experience working with mobile systems and/or as a system designer.
* Proficiency in software architecture and systemization.
* Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written.
* Curiosity and enthusiasm for leading technical studies and exploring new technologies.
* Educational background at the PhD or MSc level in computer engineering, electrical engineering, telecom, or equivalent knowledge.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 760846
   

  

 ]]>

title: Lead Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Solita är experter på data och AI, och tillsammans skapar vi lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att fatta smartare och snabbare affärsbeslut. Vi arbetar agnostiskt när det gäller teknikstackar och med moderna ramverk och plattformar lämpliga för att möjliggöra data och AI-tjänster.
 



 Vi söker en Lead Developer – Skapa framtidens lösningar med Solita
 



  





 Vi har nyligen startat en utvecklingsenhet i Sverige och vill nu stärka upp med utåtriktade utvecklare. Hos oss kommer du ta en ledande roll i vår resa att skapa framtidens tekniska lösningar där möjliggörande av data och införandet av AI kommer spela stor roll.
 



  





 Så här säger Rebecca Hammel, Head of Software Development, om visionen för enheten:
 



 ”Jag är oerhört entusiastisk över att få leda detta nya team och bidra till Solitas fortsatta tillväxt. Vi skapar en miljö där systemutvecklare, data engineers, data scientists och slutanvändare arbetar nära tillsammans för att snabbt leverera affärsvärde med hjälp av den senaste tekniken inom Analytics och AI”.
 



  





**Vad Vi Erbjuder** 




 Att vara konsult på Solita innebär en dynamisk och varierad arbetsdag. En konsult beskriver sin roll som en “Glue Engineer”, vilket innebär att man binder samman olika projekt genom att kombinera kundinteraktion, förundersökningar och kodning. Varje dag är unik; ibland arbetar man på kontoret i Stockholm, ibland hos en kund och ibland hemifrån. Denna flexibilitet gör konsultlivet både mångsidigt och utvecklande. Vi erbjuder även:
 



  




* Flexibilitet: Arbeta i en agil miljö där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Ständig utveckling Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling med fokus på både AI och modern systemutveckling genom infosessions, certifieringar, digitala läromedel, föreläsningar samt många andra format
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling
* Bra villkor och sociala aktiviteter! Ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat där vi värnar om ditt personliga välmående samt säkerställer att vi har kul tillsammans
* Kontor och arbetsmiljö: Solita har kontor på flera geografiska platser, inklusive Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med moderna faciliteter och flexibla arbetsytor som främjar samarbete och kreativitet.



  





  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att passa i rollen ser vi att du:
 


* Vill kombinera din tekniska kompetens med pre-sales och utveckling av nya erbjudanden
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling inom C# .NET eller Java Spring Boot
* Har erfarenhet av att leda/coacha utvecklare
* Har bred erfarenhet av teknologier som distribuerade system, datahanteringsverktyg, orkestrering, CI/CD samt molnplattformar
* Är van att jobba enligt Dev(Sec)Ops
* Brinner för att möjliggöra data och intresserad av att bygga AI-lösningar
* Har god kännedom kring skalbar arkitektur och eventdriven arkitektur



  





**Om Solita** 




 Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 8 länder, varav 200 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
 



  





**Våra förmåner** 




 Utöver en konkurrenskraftig, fast lön erbjuder vi ett komplett förmånspaket som inkluderar:
 


* 30 semesterdagar
* Fredagsfrukost
* After Work-aktiviteter
* Bike leasing
* Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
* Möjlighet till pensionsavsättningar även under föräldraledighet



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens tekniska lösningar inom AI och data? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Skriv till Nils på LinkedIn eller skicka ett mail på nils.larsen@solita.se. Det går även fint att chatta eller maila till Sebastian på sebastian.laine@solita.se.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
**Be part of something bigger. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are looking for a Senior Platform Engineer to join our Platform Services team. Platform Services is responsible for constructing and maintaining the foundational infrastructure and services that power Electrolux’s entire engineering organization. Our Developer Platform empowers engineers to efficiently ship products, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.
   

  

 Our team enables product teams to concentrate on delivering core business features. Our technical challenges span a wide range, including infrastructure provisioning, API development, service deployment, observability, FinOps, and new AI product development.
   

  

 This role will play a crucial part in shaping the future of Electrolux’s smart appliance development. By contributing to the underlying platform, you will directly impact the innovation and user experience of our connected devices.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design and implement user-friendly and efficient frontend interfaces.
* Build robust and scalable backend services that power our platform.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other engineers, to deliver high-quality solutions.


**Qualifications:**
* Proficiency in frontend technologies such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
* 5+ years experience with large-scale backend development.
* Strong programming skills and a desire to automate everything.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and infrastructure as code tools.
* Strong communication skills in English.
* Passion for building developer tools and improving developer experience.


**Where you’ll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services.
* Family-friendly benefits.
* Insurance policy plan.
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

title: Marketing Video & Graphic Artist
description:
Aquila Interactive is a game publisher and developer focused on creating thoughtful and complex games that allow players to shape their own stories. Our mission is to craft immersive experiences while fostering communities that contribute and engage with our projects. Currently, we are working on exciting titles like
 *Gilded Destiny* 
 and
 *Global Magnates* 
 .
 



  





 To support our marketing efforts, we are looking for a talented
 **Marketing Video & Graphic Artist** 
 to join our growing team and help us visually bring our projects to life.
 



  





**Job Overview:** 




 As a Marketing Video & Graphic Artist, you will play a key role in creating compelling visual assets that showcase our games and connect with our audience. This includes producing high-quality videos, trailers, social media graphics, and promotional materials. You will work closely with our marketing and design teams to craft visuals that captivate and engage our growing community of players.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* **Video Production:** 
 Create game trailers, teaser videos, and other promotional content for marketing campaigns.
* **Graphic Design:** 
 Design promotional materials such as social media posts, banners, infographics, and other marketing assets.
* **Branding Support:** 
 Ensure all visual materials align with Aquila Interactive's branding guidelines and the tone of each game.
* **Motion Graphics:** 
 Develop motion graphics and animations to bring dynamic elements to marketing campaigns.
* **Collaborate with Teams:** 
 Work closely with the marketing team, content designers, and external partners to ensure consistency in visual storytelling.
* **Iteration:** 
 Revise and adapt content based on feedback to meet evolving project goals.
* **Asset Management:** 
 Organize, maintain, and manage design files and marketing assets.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a video editor or graphic designer, ideally in the gaming or entertainment industry.
* Proficiency in tools such as Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, and other video/graphic design software.
* Strong understanding of composition, typography, and color theory.
* Experience creating marketing materials for social media platforms (e.g., Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok).
* Knowledge of game trailers or gameplay video editing is a plus.
* Passion for video games, especially strategy and simulation titles, is highly desirable.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work in a collaborative, remote team environment and meet deadlines.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Flexible working hours.
* Opportunity to contribute to the marketing of groundbreaking strategy games.
* A supportive team culture focused on collaboration and growth.

title: Lead Full Stack Software Engineer (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Full Stack Engineering Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda’s marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Lead engineer is the key role in our technology organization working together with individual contributors and senior leadership. Our Lead engineers are heavily involved in the hiring and mentoring process and are the go-to people who design and implement new systems and components. We are looking for people who are passionate to take on more responsibility and driving major architectural changes in Agoda. It’s expected from you in this role as Lead engineer to push Agoda forward technically by adopting new technologies and setting higher standards.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Maintain ownership and responsibility of mission critical systems
* Be hands on – build high volume platforms using cutting-edge technologies like React and GraphQL
* Mentor and coach other software engineers
* Be a major contributor to our agile and scrum practices
* Design and lead crucial technical projects and initiatives cross teams and departments
* Stay on the leading edge of technical know-how, industry trends and drive technical innovations


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* 10+ years of experience developing web applications in client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, VueJS, etc. 6+ years preferred
* B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred
* Working experience with agile, analytics, A/B testing and/or feature flags, Continuous Delivery, Trunk-based Development
* Excellent HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too
* Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript
* You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack
* Great communication and coordination skills
* Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
* You have a good command of the English language


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Knowledge in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions
* Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (Cassandra, ScyllaDB, ElasticSearch, Redis, DynamoDB, etc), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, Azure Service Bus, etc)
* Working Experience with Containers and Dockerization, also K8S is a plus
* Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions would be a plus
* Strong experience in all aspects of client-side performance optimization,
* Extremely proficient in modern coding and design practices. For example, Clean Code, SOLID principals, and TDD
* Experience in multiple front-end platforms including iOS, Android, Web, and API services
* Have worked on an app or internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second
* Have experience in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data
* Lead teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems
* Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and data


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**
